item.title: Euro zone inflation up a notch to 2.2% in November, flash data shows
item.description: Euro zone inflation stood at 2.2% in November, a slight rise from the previous month, flash data from data agency Eurostat showed Tuesday.

item.title: An industry focused on death faces an existential crisis
item.description: The small, family run companies that make traditional memorialization products like gravestones are facing the dual challenges of tariffs and crematio...

item.title: Consumer confidence hits lowest point since April as job worries grow
item.description: The board's Consumer Confidence Index slumped to 88.7, a drop of 6.8 points from the prior month for its lowest reading in seven months.

item.title: Private payroll losses accelerated in the past four weeks, ADP reports
item.description: Private companies lost an average of 13,500 jobs a week over the past four weeks, ADP said Tuesday.

item.title: Core wholesale prices rose less than expected in September; retail sales gain
item.description: The producer price index was expected to increase 0.3% in September, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.
